intro: Fagara bachmannii, commonly known as Bachmann's sassafras, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns red when mature. Fagara bachmannii is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
